ci_support_linux_c_compilergcc.yaml:
build_number_decrement:
- '0'
c_compiler:
- gcc
channel_sources:
- conda-forge/label/gcc7,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge gcc7
docker_image:
- conda/c3i-linux-64
jpeg:
- '9'
libpng:
- 1.6.34
pin_run_as_build:
  jpeg:
    max_pin: x
  libpng:
    max_pin: x.x
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler
  - channel_sources
  - channel_targets
  - docker_image
  - build_number_decrement

about.description:
Fig2dev is a set of tools for creating TeX documents with graphics
which are portable, in the sense that they can be printed in a wide
variety of environments.
Fig2dev consists of the fig2dev and the transfig commands.  The fig2dev
command translates Fig code to other graphic description languages.  The
transfig command generates transfig.tex, a macro file for \input in a
TeX document, and a Makefile which translates Fig code to various
graphics description languages using the fig2dev program.
about.summary: Convert Fig files to other formats

about.description:
Fig2dev is a set of tools for creating TeX documents with graphics

Fig2dev consists of the fig2dev and the transfig commands.  The fig2dev

transfig command generates transfig.tex, a macro file for \input in a

graphics description languages using the fig2dev program.
about.summary: Convert Fig files to other formats

name: fig2dev

about.description:
Fig2dev is a set of tools for creating TeX documents with graphics
which are portable, in the sense that they can be printed in a wide
variety of environments.
Fig2dev consists of the fig2dev and the transfig commands.  The fig2dev
command translates Fig code to other graphic description languages.  The
transfig command generates transfig.tex, a macro file for \input in a
TeX document, and a Makefile which translates Fig code to various
graphics description languages using the fig2dev program.
about.summary: Convert Fig files to other formats

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "fig2dev" %}
{% set version = "3.2.6a" %}
{% set sha256 = "5e61a3d9a4f83db4b3199ee82dd54bb65b544369f1e8e38a2606c44cf71667a7" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.xz
  url: https://sourceforge.net/projects/mcj/files/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.xz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 1000
  skip: True  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - libpng
    - jpeg
    - ghostscript
    - xorg-libx11
    - xorg-libxpm
    - xorg-libxt
  run:
    - libpng
    - jpeg
    - ghostscript
    - xorg-libx11
    - xorg-libxpm
    - xorg-libxt

test:
  commands:
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX $PKG_NAME  # [not win]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX $PKG_NAME  # [osx]
    - fig2dev -V
    - transfig -V

about:
  home: http://mcj.sourceforge.net
  license: GPLv3
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: 'Convert Fig files to other formats'

  description: |
    Fig2dev is a set of tools for creating TeX documents with graphics
    which are portable, in the sense that they can be printed in a wide
    variety of environments.
    Fig2dev consists of the fig2dev and the transfig commands.  The fig2dev
    command translates Fig code to other graphic description languages.  The
    transfig command generates transfig.tex, a macro file for \input in a
    TeX document, and a Makefile which translates Fig code to various
    graphics description languages using the fig2dev program.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - epruesse
